title: Wills on Global Migration to Britain MCQ 1

content.question: Which of the following best explains why the author brings up the example of the Sikh migrant cutting his hair before coming to England as a way of supporting her argument that the experiences of South Asian and European immigrants to Britain were “poles apart”?

choices.label: Unlike European immigrants, South Asian immigrants were escaping poverty and economic stagnation in their homeland.
Unlike European immigrants, South Asian immigrants could count on the support of existing large migrant communities from their countries of birth.
Unlike European immigrants, South Asian immigrants had to suppress parts of their culture and remove important religious symbols to fit into British society.
Unlike European immigrants, South Asian immigrants brought to Britain cultural norms and religious symbols that gave them advantages in competing for industrial jobs.

content.answer: Unlike European immigrants, South Asian immigrants had to suppress parts of their culture and remove important religious symbols to fit into British society.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
